Dr Haiko Muller | School of Computer Science | University of Leeds Skip to main content University links Search Destination Faculty of Engineering and Physical Sciences site All leeds.ac.uk sites School of Computer Science Search Faculty of Engineering and Physical Sciences School of Computer Science People Profile Dr Haiko Muller Position: Senior Lecturer Areas of expertise: algorithms; complexity; graph theory Email: H.Muller@leeds.ac.uk Phone: +44(0)113 343 5445 Location: 3.20 Chemistry Website: group page | ORCID Responsibilities Study Abroad Coordinator Research interests Haiko's research interests are algorithms and complexity, especially: algorithms on graphs and partially ordered sets approximative and randomized algorithms graph theory and special classes of graphs See the Algorithms and Complexity research group page for further information. Research groups and institutes Algorithms and Complexity

Postgraduate research opportunities

We welcome enquiries from motivated and qualified applicants from all around the world who are interested in PhD study. Our research opportunities allow you to search for projects and scholarships.
